page.title: 01Fen in W Norfolk
page.content: From a high point approximately 140 ft in the north east, the land drops away to some 20 feet above sea level in the West. Through the Southwest corner flows the river Wissey, with enlands to the west and sandy breackland soil dominating the eastern half, much of which is afforested by the forestry commission. This soil also units the growing of carrots, parsnips and turnips, with free rane pigs used to rest and enrich the soil. Cereals and sugar beet alternate on the heavier land in the west, together with grazing. The only residential are is folden in the N West corner, population about 340. The younger children travel by schoolbus to nearby gooderstone, and the older to Methwold some five miles. Available employment is in foresty, farming, vegetable packing plant and neary
